name: pointillistic
content:
pointillistic adjective
(ART)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in or relating to a style of painting developed in France at the end of the 19th century in which small spots of pure colour are used that seem to mix when seen from far away: She paints in a pointillistic style. The pots are decorated with a pointillistic pattern. Related word
pointillismSynonym
pointillist
More examplesFewer examplesShe has a fine collection of pointillistic art.The artist uses circular brush strokes and pointillistic shading.

pointillistic adjective
(DETAILED)
using very small units of sound, very detailed descriptions, etc. to create an artistic effect: Her pointillistic narrative technique can make for dreary reading. In the middle of the piece there is a delicate pointillistic piano solo.
More examplesFewer examplesThe music now became pointillistic and moody.He wrote a brilliant, pointillistic history of the American Civil War.
